Have you ever wondered whether your wand type is popular or rare? How about what its core and wood would mean for you as a witch or wizard? ","mainImage":{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-25T14:27:59.153000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"3jerbizJATtIAYpWMsuT8y","entryTitle":"HP-F5-weasleys-wands-da-web-header","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-25T14:27:56.129000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"1gE7AkTcqfvGDvOzg53aBK","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1200,"width":3000},"size":2361336},"fileName":"weasleys-web-cover.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/1gE7AkTcqfvGDvOzg53aBK/566808c8ebddfb02cade33a9ac8ad685/weasleys-web-cover.jpg"},"title":"HP-F5-weasleys-wands-da-web-header"}},"publishDate":"2020-03-25T00:00:00","section":[{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-25T14:37:18.825000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"4fvamLLZ46anqM4w7ArR32","entryTitle":"wand-right-for-you-text-section-1","text":"First things first, if you haven’t yet discovered your wand, [here’s a link ](https://my.pottermore.com/wand) to our test written by J.K. Rowling. And remember... the wand chooses you, not the other way around. \n\nNow you’ve discovered your personal wand, just like Harry did in Mr Ollivander’s shop in Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone, you most likely want to find out a bit more about what your wand type would mean for you in the wizarding world… \n\n## Ten most common core and wood combinations\n\n1.\tUnicorn core and sycamore wood – most common\u003cbr\u003e\n2.\tUnicorn core and laurel wood\u003cbr\u003e\n3.\tDragon core and sycamore wood\u003cbr\u003e\n4.\tPhoenix core and sycamore wood\u003cbr\u003e\n5.\tUnicorn core and alder wood\u003cbr\u003e\n6.\tUnicorn core and vine wood\u003cbr\u003e\n7.\tPhoenix core and laurel wood\u003cbr\u003e\n8.\tDragon core and laurel wood\u003cbr\u003e\n9.\tUnicorn core and redwood\u003cbr\u003e\n10.\tUnicorn core and hazel wood \u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Top three rarest core and wood combinations\n\n1.\tPhoenix and poplar\u003cbr\u003e\n2.\tDragon and poplar\u003cbr\u003e\n3.\tUnicorn and poplar\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## What core does your wand have?\n\nMr Ollivander used only three substances for wand cores. Three he deemed of enough quality to give the illustrious name of Ollivander: unicorn hair, dragon heartstring and phoenix feather. \n\n## Which one of the three cores does your wand have? \n\n### Unicorn hair\n\n__Wizarding world characters who share this core: Ron Weasley, Neville Longbottom, Cedric Diggory__\n\nIf your wand is unicorn hair, this core, according to [Ollivander’s notes](https://www.wizardingworld.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/wand-cores), ‘generally produces the most consistent magic, and is least subject to fluctuations and blockages. They are generally the most difficult to turn to the Dark Arts. The most faithful of all wands, they usually remain attached to their first owner, irrespective of whether he or she was an accomplished witch of wizard. Minor disadvantages of a unicorn hair core are that they do not make the most powerful wands (although the wand wood may compensate) and that they are prone to melancholy if seriously mishandled, meaning that the hair may “die” and need replacing.’ \n\n### Dragon heartstring\n\n__Wizarding world characters who share this core: Hermione Granger, Bellatrix Lestrange, Viktor Krum__\n\nIf your wand is dragon heartstring, this core as a rule produces ‘wands with the most power, and which are capable of the most flamboyant spells. Dragon wands tend to learn more quickly than other types. While they can change allegiance if won from their original master, they always bond strongly with the current owner. The dragon wand tends to be the easiest to turn to the Dark Arts, though it will not incline that way of its own accord. It is also the most prone of the three cores to accidents, being somewhat temperamental.’ \n\n### Phoenix feather\n\n__Wizarding world characters who share this core: Harry Potter, Lord Voldemort, Silvanus Kettleburn__\n\nThis is the rarest core type of our Wizarding World fans, and in the wizarding world itself: ‘Phoenix feathers are capable of the greatest range of magic, though they may take longer than either unicorn or dragon cores to reveal this.\n\nThey show the most initiative, sometimes acting of their own accord, a quality that many witches and wizards dislike. Phoenix feather wands are always the pickiest when it comes to potential owners, for the creature from which they are taken is one of the most independent and detached in the world. These wands are the hardest to tame and to personalise, and their allegiance is usually hard won.' "},{"_updatedAt":"2020-01-21T15:09:24.081000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"62IdEUawa2yEdvcH6vR0ib","entryTitle":"HP-F8-ollivander-wand-02672A","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-01-21T15:09:11.934000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"2WrEdxSxfcUJmhnhNlmN3k","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1121,"width":900},"size":774184},"fileName":"ollivander.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/2WrEdxSxfcUJmhnhNlmN3k/6927c63a360f952ef954f36b2a416fc3/ollivander.jpg"},"title":"HP-F8-ollivander-wand-02672A"},"source":[{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-28T16:41:07.299000","contentTypeId":"source","contentfulId":"5VGVe8xvZVmCS6kECzBSpb","displayTitle":"Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2","entryTitle":"HP-F8","franchiseName":"Harry Potter","franchiseSubtitle":"and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2","purchaseLink":"https://www.wizardingworld.com/discover/films/harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows-part-2","sourceType":"Film"}]},{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-25T13:26:44.658000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"64IyUoXwkc0YiwHPA45Dcn","entryTitle":"wand-right-for-you-text-section-2","text":"### What wood is your wand made of?\n\nThese are the top ten wand woods from those who have discovered their wands through WizardingWorld.com (and previously on Pottermore). If your wand wood doesn’t make it on to this list don’t worry – [you can read all about the types of wood in full here.](https://www.wizardingworld.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/wand-woods)\n\n__Sycamore – most popular__\n\n•\tA questing wand; eager for new experience and loses brilliance if engaged in the mundane.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tMay burst into flame if allowed to become ‘bored’.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tIdeal owner is curious, vital and adventurous. \u003cbr\u003e\n•\tWhen paired with its ideal owner, it demonstrates a capacity to learn and adapt that earns it a rightful place among the world’s most highly-prized wand woods.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Laurel – 2nd most popular__\n\n•\tIt is said that a laurel wand cannot perform a dishonourable act, although Ollivander has known them to perform powerful and sometimes lethal magic in the quest for glory.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tSeems unable to tolerate laziness in a possessor, and in such conditions,  it is most easily and willingly worn away.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tOtherwise it will cleave happily to its first match forever and can issue a spontaneous lightning strike if another witch or wizard attempts to steal it.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Alder – 3rd most popular__\n\n•\tAlthough an unyielding wood, its ideal owner is helpful, considerate and likeable. \u003cbr\u003e\n•\tWhen happily placed, an alder wand becomes a magnificent, loyal helpmate.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tBest suited to non-verbal spell work, whence comes its reputation for being suitable only for the most advanced witches and wizards.\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Hazel – 4th most popular__\n\n•\tA sensitive wand, hazel often reflects its owner’s emotional state and works best for a master who understands and can manage their own feelings.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tCapable of outstanding magic in the hands of the skilful.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tSo devoted to its owner that it often ‘wilts’ at the end of its master’s life – if the core is also unicorn hair, the wand will almost certainly completely ‘die’. \u003cbr\u003e\n•\tHazel wands have the unique ability to detect water underground.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Vine – 5th most popular__\n\n•\tOwners are nearly always those who seek a greater purpose, who have a vision beyond the ordinary and who frequently astound those who think they know them best.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tVine wands seem strongly attracted to personalities with hidden depths and are more sensitive than any other when it comes to instantly detecting a prospective match.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tReliable sources claim that vine wands emit magical effects upon the mere entrance into their room of a suitable owner.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Redwood – 6th most popular__\n\n•\tWand-quality redwood has a reputation for bringing good fortune to its owner – however, according to Ollivander, this is the wrong way around.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tRedwood wands are strongly attracted to those who already possess the admirable ability to fall on their feet, to make the right choice and to snatch advantage from catastrophe.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tOllivander generally expects to hear of exciting things when such a person is paired with a redwood wand.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Beech – 7th most popular__\n\n•\tIf you are young, you will be best suited to a beech core if you are wise beyond your years.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tIf you are fully grown, you will be best suited to beech if you are rich in understanding and experience.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tBeech wands perform very weakly for the narrow-minded and intolerant.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tWhen properly matched, beech is capable of a subtlety and artistry rarely seen in other woods.\n\n__Maple – 8th most popular__\n\n•\tThose chosen by maple wands are often travellers and explorers by nature.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tMaple wands are not stay-at-home wands, and prefer ambition in their owners, otherwise their magic grows heavy and lacklustre.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tFresh challenges and regular changes of scene cause this wand to literally shine, burnishing itself as it grows with its partner in ability and status.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tPossession of a maple wand has long been a mark of status, because of its reputation as the wand of high achievers.\n\n__Rowan – 9th most popular__\n\n•\tRowan is reputed to be more protective than any other wand, and renders all manner of defensive charms especially strong and difficult to break.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tIt is commonly stated that no Dark witch or wizard ever owned a rowan wand – and Ollivander cannot recall one of his rowan wands going out to do evil in the world.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tWands of rowan wood are most happily placed with the clear-headed and the pure-hearted.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tHowever, this reputation for virtue ought not to fool anyone – these wands are the equal of any, often the better, and frequently out-perform others in duels.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Cypress – 10th most popular__\n\n•\tCypress wands are associated with nobility. \u003cbr\u003e\n•\tThe great medieval wandmaker, Geraint Ollivander, wrote that he was always honoured to match a cypress wand, for he knew he was meeting a witch or wizard who would die a heroic death.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tFortunately, in less bloodthirsty times, the possessors of cypress wands are rarely called upon to lay down their lives, though doubtless many of them would do so if required.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tWands of cypress find their soulmates among the brave, the bold and the self-sacrificing: those who are unafraid to confront the shadows in their own and others’ natures.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n### A note on the rarest wood amongst Wizarding World fans:\n\n__Poplar – rarest__\n\n•\t‘If you seek integrity, search first among the poplars’, was a great maxim of Ollivander’s grandfather, and his grandson reports that his own experience tallies exactly with this impression.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tPoplar is a wand to rely upon – of consistency, strength and uniform power.\u003cbr\u003e\n•\tThis wand wood is always happiest when working with those of clear moral vision.\u003cbr\u003e\n\n__Something to keep in mind:__ ‘Every single wand is unique and will depend for its character on the particular tree and magical creature from which it derives its materials.\n\nMoreover, each wand, from the moment it finds its ideal owner, will begin to learn from and teach its human partner.’ [Therefore, as J.K. Rowling reminds us through Ollivander](https://www.wizardingworld.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/mr-ollivander), these notes ‘should be regarded very much as a starting point, for this is the study of a lifetime, and I continue to learn with every wand I make and match.’ "}],"tags":[{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:07:02.831000","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"L1Cef6BUiA2eC84VPklgq","name":"hide-from-app"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:06:54.732000","authorComment":"This excludes the content item from its index page i.e. quizzes run to Quiz section automatically, but for other Quiz content (publishing elsewhere) it excludes from Discover. And all along the corridor the statues and suits of armour jumped down from their plinths, and from the echoing crashes from the floors above and below, Harry knew that their fellows throughout the castle had done the same.\n\n‘Hogwarts is threatened!’ shouted Professor McGonagall. ‘Man the boundaries, protect us, do your duty to our school!\"\n\n__Transfiguration would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou’re good at understanding complicated diagrams \n\n•\tyour mind is more scientific than creative\n\n•\tyou’re a perfectionist\n\n•\tyou have excellent concentration\n\n•\tyou learn and accept that there are limits on what can be achieved – think Gamp’s Law\n\n## Charms\n__A moment that Charms charmed us:__\n\n\"I can act from here,’ said Flitwick, and although he could barely see out of it, he pointed his wand through the smashed window and started muttering incantations of great complexity. Harry heard a weird rushing noise, as though Flitwick had unleashed the power of the wind into the grounds.’ \n\n__Charms would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou enjoy creativity\n\n•\tyou’re imaginative\n\n•\tyou’d be keen for a duel (Professor Flitwick was a duelling champion!)\n\n•\tyou find it easy to pronounce tricky words and phrases, like Wingardium Leviosa\n\n•\tyou have a good memory for incantations \n\n## Defence Against the Dark Arts\n__A moment Defence Against the Dark Arts awed us:__\n\n\"The Dark Arts,’ said Snape, ‘are many, varied, ever-changing and eternal. Fighting them is like fighting a many-headed monster, which, each time a neck is severed, sprouts a head even fiercer and cleverer than before. You are fighting that which is unfixed, mutating, indestructible.\"\n\n__Defence Against the Dark Arts would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou have fast physical and mental reactions \n\n•\tyou are quick to adapt to new situations and threats\n\n•\tyou are inventive (just think about all those spells the Half-Blood Prince came up with)\n\n•\tyou have good defensive instincts – in Defence Against the Dark Arts there isn’t always time for planning\n\n•\tyou think that ‘know your enemy’ is a good mantra\n"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:10:48.595000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"6bZYEWQWhqU0yI48ayiguC-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-PomonaSprout WB F1 SproutHoldingMandrake Still 080615 Land 19XNcDarUkueukokWKWAgq-b1","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:11:01.748000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"6bZYEWQWhqU0yI48ayiguC","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":3245,"width":5000},"size":3038221},"fileName":"PomonaSprout_WB_F1_SproutHoldingMandrake_Still_080615_Land.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/6bZYEWQWhqU0yI48ayiguC/728737ed42915dd64187b28a37570717/PomonaSprout_WB_F1_SproutHoldingMandrake_Still_080615_Land.jpg"},"title":"PomonaSprout WB F1 SproutHoldingMandrake Still 080615 Land"}},{"_updatedAt":"2020-09-03T15:52:29.867000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"5OyGLIPKWQh8gz0SPWDSNb","entryTitle":"WEB-FEATURE-2020-which-first-year-hogwarts-subject-would-most-suit-you-text-section-2","text":"## Herbology\n__A moment Herbology made us shout hooray:__\n\n\"Oh, right!’ said Hermione, and she whipped out her wand, waved it, muttered something and sent a jet of the same bluebell flames she had used on Snape at the plant. In a matter of seconds, the two boys felt it loosening its grip as it cringed away from the light and warmth. Wriggling and flailing, it unravelled itself from their bodies and they were able to pull free.\n‘Lucky you pay attention in Herbology, Hermione,’ said Harry as he joined her by the wall, wiping sweat off his face.'\n\n__Herbology would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou like being outdoors\n\n•\tyou don’t mind a bit of mud and dirt\n\n•\tyou are patient – just think how long those Mandrakes took to reach maturity!\n\n•\tyou have a good memory for complicated names, like Mimbulus mimbletonia\n\n•\tyou are a caring person – we reckon magical plants need a lot of love\n\n## Astronomy\n__A moment Astronomy amazed us:__\n\n\"I know that you have learned the names of the planets and their moons in Astronomy,’ said Firenze’s calm voice, ‘and that you have mapped the stars’ progress through the heavens. Centaurs have unravelled the mysteries of these movements over centuries. Our findings teach us that the future may be glimpsed in the sky above us –\"\n\n__Astronomy would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou like maps – both creating them and reading them\n\n•\tyou prefer night to day \n\n•\tyou aren’t afraid of heights – lessons take place up the Astronomy Tower!\n\n•\tyou have good eyesight – for using a telescope and plotting star charts\n\n•\tyou like to ponder the wider universe and our place in it\n\n## History of Magic \n__A moment History of Magic excited us:__\n\n\"All the copies of Hogwarts: A History have been taken out,’ she said, sitting down next to Harry and Ron. ‘And there’s a two-week waiting list. I wish I hadn’t left my copy at home, but I couldn’t fit it in my trunk with all the Lockhart books.’\n\n‘Why do you want it?’ said Harry.\n\n‘The same reason everyone else wants it,’ said Hermione, ‘to read up on the legend of the Chamber of Secrets.\"\n\n__History of Magic would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou enjoy learning names and dates – especially of giant wars and goblin rebellions\n\n•\tyou are immune to the sleep-inducing effects of a droning voice (mentioning no names…ehem…Professor Binns!)\n\n•\tyou wouldn’t mind being taught by a ghost\n\n•\tyou appreciate that history is inextricably linked to the modern day\n\n•\tyou like secrets – just look at all the amazing things that Hermione found out from Hogwarts: A History!\n\n## Potions\n__A moment Potions impressed us:__\n\n\"As there is little foolish wand-waving here, many of you will hardly believe this is magic. I don’t expect you will really understand the beauty of the softly simmering cauldron with its shimmering fumes, the delicate power of liquids that creep through human veins, bewitching the mind, ensnaring the senses ... I can teach you how to bottle fame, brew glory, even stopper death – if you aren’t as big a bunch of dunderheads as I usually have to teach.\"\n\n__Potions would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou like following instructions\n\n•\tyou have excellent attention to detail \n\n•\tyou’re precise when it comes to measurements or amounts\n\n•\tyou aren’t squeamish – there are often leeches or rat tails involved in brewing!\n\n•\tyou are patient \n\n## Flying\n__A moment flying made our hearts soar:__\n‘He mounted the broom and kicked hard against the ground and up, up he soared, air rushed through his hair and his robes whipped out behind him – and in a rush of fierce joy he realised he’d found something he could do without being taught – this was easy, this was wonderful. He pulled his broomstick up a little to take it even higher and heard screams and gasps of girls back on the ground and an admiring whoop from Ron.’\n\n__Flying would suit you if:__\n\n•\tyou have good balance\n\n•\tyou don’t mind heights \n\n•\tyou prefer to rely on instinct and feeling rather than facts from a book\n\n•\tyou enjoy travelling at speed\n\n•\tyou’re competitive and love an adrenaline rush\n"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:06:09.976000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"3ELjmNnN16YSSowWOA2sWs-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-WB F1 MadamHoochNevilleLongbottom QuidditchLesson HPFC-03 YW24X63JssAOeeycsOke6-b5","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:32:02.254000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"3ELjmNnN16YSSowWOA2sWs","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2286,"width":3000},"size":1020180},"fileName":"WB F1 MadamHoochNevilleLongbottom QuidditchLesson HPFC-03.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/3ELjmNnN16YSSowWOA2sWs/b098f1953be10ee5030a5fbc21210882/WB_F1_MadamHoochNevilleLongbottom_QuidditchLesson_HPFC-03.jpg"},"title":"WB F1 MadamHoochNevilleLongbottom QuidditchLesson HPFC-03"}},{"_updatedAt":"2020-09-03T15:43:29.356000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3lcOVrTIGoueYs8S0TM8mb","entryTitle":"WEB-FEATURE-2020-which-first-year-hogwarts-subject-would-most-suit-you-text-section-3","text":"So, which of these subjects sounds most like you? A Slytherin? A Ravenclaw? Here’s why she belonged in the house of the badger… ","mainImage":{"_updatedAt":"2020-04-14T11:10:11.123000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"38mDaA3ivEXbCjfbS4Co03","entryTitle":"Nymphadora-tonks-HP5-moody-wand-privet-drive-image","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-04-14T11:10:07.670000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"6k4I27ry8fNjBgcsekjuFi","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1333,"width":2000},"size":1727070},"fileName":"tonks-purple-hair-order-of-the-phoenix-with-moody.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/6k4I27ry8fNjBgcsekjuFi/f945665e121e48fd4e3e338f01267cff/tonks-purple-hair-order-of-the-phoenix-with-moody.jpg"},"title":"Nymphadora-tonks-HP5-moody-wand-privet-drive-image"}},"publishDate":"2020-04-13T23:00:00","section":[{"_updatedAt":"2020-04-14T10:41:39.657000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"6yi9UP4WTa6vgaZ5dZAk07","entryTitle":"WEB-2020-FEATURE-why-tonks-was-a-true-hufflepuff-text-section-1","text":"## She was loyal\n\nThe loyalty of Nymphadora Tonks was never called into question – not once across the whole Harry Potter series. She might have been a loyal member of the Order of the Phoenix, but ‘*don’t call me Nymphadora*’ Tonks was fighting Dark wizards as an Auror before we ever got to meet her in the books. \n\nWe shouldn’t be surprised. The Sorting Hat told us Hufflepuffs were loyal in the first ever song we heard it sing in *Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone*. The head of Hufflepuff house, Professor Sprout, had this trait in spades. Loyal to Dumbledore, the Herbology teacher openly opposed Dolores Umbridge over the sacking of Professor Trelawney, and also awarded Harry twenty points just for passing her a watering can, after his Quibbler interview about the return of Voldemort. \n\nA Hufflepuff’s loyalty to the good side is demonstrated clearly in Tonks, and it is extended to people as well, particularly an unswerving loyalty to The Boy Who Lived. Remember that time the conductor of the Knight Bus almost gave away Harry’s location? ‘*If you shout his name I will curse you into oblivion,*’ Tonks warned. You don’t mess with Tonks. Beyond Harry, it’s worth remembering that even after the death of her father and giving birth to her son Teddy, Tonks was still determined to fight at the Battle of Hogwarts.\n\n## *‘Said Hufflepuff, ‘I’ll teach the lot,/ And treat them just the same.’*\n\nFrom a variation of the Sorting Hat song we heard in *Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix*, Helga Hufflepuff’s attitude about equality was one that passed down to generations of Hufflepuff students. Just think about Professor Sprout, who channelled the house founder when she said, after Dumbledore’s death, ‘*I feel that if a single pupil wants to come, then the school ought to remain open for that pupil*.’ \n\nTonks too prized individuality of spirit – just look at the pink hair she rocked – and accepted people no matter who they were or where they came from. Remus Lupin’s identity as a werewolf didn’t bother her one bit – in fact it frustrated her that he thought of himself as so ‘other’: \n\n*'You see!’ said a strained voice. Tonks was glaring at Lupin. ‘She still wants to marry him, even though he’s been bitten! She doesn’t care!’*\n\n*‘It’s different,’ said Lupin, barely moving his lips and looking suddenly tense. ‘Bill will not be a full werewolf. The cases are completely –’*\n\n*‘But I don’t care either, I don’t care!’ said Tonks, seizing the front of Lupin’s robes and shaking them. ‘I’ve told you a million times …'*\n\n__*Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince*__\n"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T19:04:11.544000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"1nxLlGaopSE24QgkwcYO0A-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-NymphadoraTonks WB F6 TonksLookingScaredWithLupinNextToHer Still 080615 Land 6rCuV1gObuZDVcb3qfEuS5-b7","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:33:15.087000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"1nxLlGaopSE24QgkwcYO0A","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1234,"width":2048},"size":266128},"fileName":"NymphadoraTonks_WB_F6_TonksLookingScaredWithLupinNextToHer_Still_080615_Land.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/1nxLlGaopSE24QgkwcYO0A/05cda252b22b65f1b32927639c18de48/NymphadoraTonks_WB_F6_TonksLookingScaredWithLupinNextToHer_Still_080615_Land.jpg"},"title":"NymphadoraTonks WB F6 TonksLookingScaredWithLupinNextToHer Still 080615 Land"},"imageAltText":"Tonks looking scared with Lupin at her side from the Half Blood Prince.","imageCaption":"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-04-14T10:36:57.474000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"4RdsJO3Y9lLIaUKGLs69OM","entryTitle":"WEB-2020-FEATURE-why-tonks-was-a-true-hufflepuff-text-section-2","text":"## She was unafraid of toil\n\nDespite Tonks downplaying her job as a Dark wizard catcher, we know that it was one of the hardest careers to get into after Hogwarts. When Harry raised the career idea with Professor McGonagall we learned that anyone who wanted to become an Auror would need ‘top grades’ and ‘would be required to undergo a stringent series of character and aptitude tests at the Auror office.’ Yikes! That is a lot of toil.  \n\nTonks might have joked about how she, ‘*Nearly failed on Stealth and Tracking*,’ during Auror training because she was so clumsy, but the point is she didn’t actually let her clumsiness get the better of her. And at school she would have had to work really hard to get the grades she needed – ‘a minimum of five N.E.W.T.s, and nothing under “Exceeds Expectations” grade’. \n\n## She was kind\n\nKindness is not (and should not be) limited to members of Hufflepuff house but it is a trait that graced many of the house’s members. There was Newt Scamander, who took the blame for his friend Leta Lestrange’s transgression while they were at Hogwarts, and of course Cedric Diggory. Even during the competition and pressure of the Triwizard Tournament, Cedric took the time to be kind to Harry – telling his friends to stop wearing the nasty badges, for example – even though Harry really did steal his thunder when they became joint Hogwarts champions. And fellow Hufflepuff Tonks had a great deal of kindness in her heart too.\n\nWhen Harry showed an interest in how Tonks became a Metamorphmagus, she showed him empathy – expressing her understanding of why he might be interested in hiding his scar from the world, rather than making him feel self-conscious about his enquiry. Then, when Malfoy attacked Harry on the Hogwarts Express in *Half-Blood Prince*, Tonks saved him and healed his broken nose – ‘*Episkey!*’ – without a second thought, despite her own broken heart.\n\nBut Tonks’ kindness wasn’t limited to healing or sympathy. When the stakes were high transferring Harry from Privet Drive to Grimmauld Place, Tonks broke the tension by making light of Moody’s warnings about one of them getting killed: ‘*Stop being so cheerful, Mad-Eye, he’ll think we’re not taking this seriously*’. And as the strain became hard to bear at the headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix, Tonks could be found transforming her nose, Metamorphmagus-style, to entertain Hermione and Ginny. Sometimes kindness is just cheering people up when they’re in need of a good laugh.\n\n\nAny Hogwarts house would have been lucky to count Nymphadora Tonks amongst its numbers, but with apologies to Gryffindor, Slytherin and Ravenclaw – this witch is Hufflepuff through and through. \n"}],"tags":[{"_updatedAt":"2019-08-01T11:51:53.952000","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"3B1lhNkNAFaVH3lS0WLMxV","name":"feature"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:07:02.831000","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"L1Cef6BUiA2eC84VPklgq","name":"hide-from-app"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:06:54.732000","authorComment":"This excludes the content item from its index page i.e. quizzes run to Quiz section automatically, but for other Quiz content (publishing elsewhere) it excludes from Discover. Individuality is important to you; you love the limelight, but you believe working as part of a team makes your success all the more meaningful. You notice small details that other people don’t and often follow your instincts when the way forward is unclear. You are bold and brave in the face of physical danger and would never dream of running the other way. You read situations quickly, and often successfully pre-empt a particular outcome. You don’t crack under pressure, but you prefer to share the burden of responsibility with a select and trustworthy few. You’re excellent at thinking on your feet and unafraid of a challenge. You don’t shy away from hard work and are a fan of the mantra, if at first you don’t succeed, try, try again. For you, victory isn’t sweet unless it’s shared. Good or bad, that’s how you see things. You save the goal, or you let it in – no grey area exists. You stand strong in the face of adversity and cope well under pressure, as well as under intense scrutiny. You are happy to sacrifice personal glory for the good of others, even if it means you’re the centre of negative (rather than positive) attention. When it comes to a showdown, you always stand your ground. Some might describe you as an unsung hero or heroine, but you don’t need their praise to know your own worth. "},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-19T14:56:15.066000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"giVetw7dbau4pPL5INhQt","entryTitle":"Ron Keeper Quidditch falling HP6","image":{"contentfulId":"0tRib6XkHfLa35B0BXMEg"}},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-19T14:23:57.863000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"JaC4WzDpNU2jopmKGek8g","entryTitle":"which-quidditch-position-would-be-right-for-you-text-section-4","text":"## For the free-spirited exuberant, you should be a Beater \n\n*Notable Beaters*: Kevin and Karl Broadmoor, Gwenog Jones, Fred and George Weasley\n\n*Keeper objective*: Protect team members from Bludgers using a bat\n\n__Beater would be the right Quidditch position for you if…__ \n… you’re fiercely protective of your friends, sometimes taking it to... extremes. Rather than focussing on specific goals, you prefer to take life as it comes, and go with the flow. When you have a challenge in your sights, however, there’s no holding you back. You’re a team player, but only as long as you’re enjoying your own role within the group. You prefer to tackle new obstacles as they arise, rather than plan for them in advance. People call you unpredictable, mainly because you have a strong sense of fun and nobody can tie you down. You only live once, right?"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-19T14:24:05.806000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"2JTyfem5gLuU15t6RqReO3","entryTitle":"which-quidditch-position-would-be-right-for-you-text-section-5","text":"## For the thick-skinned, you should be a referee \n\n*Notable referees*: Madam Hooch, Hassan Mostafa\n\n*Referee objective*: Implement the rules of Quidditch in a fair manner\n\n__Referee would be the right Quidditch position for you if…__ \n… you have a clear and unshakeable moral compass and don’t mind getting a bit of stick. You are never swayed by bias and judge events based on the facts in front of you rather than making any assumptions, even if people are arguing otherwise. If you are convinced of a particular way forward, you will not be deterred, even if it makes you unpopular. Indeed, a referee of any sport requires a thick skin, and judging by some of the injuries we’ve heard about Quidditch referees suffering, we might mean literally. "},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-19T15:00:06.828000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"3voQ8Cxakt6DL878gtqrYq","entryTitle":"Quidditch crowd stands image","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-23T11:45:24.770000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"7CLUI5N82A4LHopGPSKHL8","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1298,"width":3072},"size":1980194},"fileName":"quidditch-pitch.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/7CLUI5N82A4LHopGPSKHL8/ccf1f630eca45784a969b9ad181611b2/quidditch-pitch.jpg"},"title":"Quidditch crowd stands image"}},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-19T14:24:14.401000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"2eC0n7DUhnq1ZsqdttJ1P2","entryTitle":"which-quidditch-position-would-be-right-for-you-text-section-6","text":"## If you have a way with words, you should be a commentator \n \n*Notable commentators*: Lee Jordan, Luna Lovegood, Ludo Bagman\n\n*Commentator objective*: Communicate the action on the Quidditch pitch to the crowd\n\n__Commentator would be the right Quidditch position for you if…__ \n… you prefer to watch the action rather than be caught up in it – but that doesn’t mean you don’t know exactly what’s going on. You like facts and figures, and you have an excellent memory for names and faces. You have a love of words and like the sound of your own voice, and others like listening to you too. You are generally trustworthy, honest and call things as you see them. You also have an infectious sense of humour and don’t mind being the centre of attention – even if you’re happy on the sidelines most of the time. And, of course, you are absolutely, 100% impartial. What was his most memorable battle? Did he really proclaim ‘constant vigilance’ or was that just an embellishment by [Barty Crouch Jr?](/features/barty-crouch-jr)\n\n## John Dawlish\n\nFor a top Auror, Dawlish sure was hexed and beaten quite a lot. When he did make an appearance in the book, he was either being shut down by Albus Dumbledore, hit with the [Confundus Charm](/features/confundo), or was being sent to St Mungo's by Neville’s Gran.\n\nDespite all his mishaps, we couldn’t help but feel there was a lot more to Dawlish than we saw. He must have been an excellent Auror, as he was often sent to do the hard jobs. (Hey, not many witches or wizards would want to be on Dumbledore’s, or even Mrs Longbottom’s, bad side.) Even Dumbledore, who must have encountered countless students in his time, remembered that Dawlish achieved ‘Outstanding’ in all his N.E.W.T.s. \n\nSure, Dawlish was a rather by-the-book kind of guy, even if at times the book was written by some incredibly nefarious people, but with him being so indiscriminately loyal to the Ministry of Magic, we could see us having some deep talks with him about loyalty, regrets, and naturally, failure. ALL SECRET CODE OR ENCHANTED CONTENT","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"5pjGg1O8g0NYmdITUba28D","name":"hide-from-discover"}]}],"section":[{"_updatedAt":"2020-09-30T09:12:31.976000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"2yu2gz5ikYxDUPGVEaY9dr","entryTitle":"web-article-which-wizarding-career-would-be-right-for-you-text-section","text":"## Auror: for the brave-hearted dueller \n\n__Notable Aurors: Mad-Eye Moody, Nymphadora Tonks, Harry Potter__ \n\n*Main responsibility: To protect the wizarding world from Dark forces* \n\nAuror would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nthe only thing you fear is fear itself. We’re kidding, but you do have to be very brave in this line of work. You’d be on the front-line, duelling and catching Dark wizards, in order to protect the wizarding world no matter what. But it’s not all brawn over brains, McGonagall advises Harry that he’d need at least five NEWTs and nothing under “Exceeds Expectations” grade to have a chance of working at the Auror office. For this career, we think you’d also need perseverance (we hear the training programme is gruelling), as well as a strong sense of justice and loyalty.  \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Hogwarts Professor: for the school-loving over-achiever  \n\n__Notable professors: Albus Dumbledore, Minerva McGonagall, Severus Snape__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Passing on your knowledge to the next generation of witches and wizards* \n\nHogwarts professor would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’re the kind of person who likes to specialise and then learn as much as you can about a particular topic. You’d need to have patience, especially if you had students in your class like troublemakers in chief, Fred and George Weasley. You would also REALLY need to love your subject, whether it be Charms, Transfiguration or Defence Against the Dark Arts – otherwise you’d have a pretty rubbish time and so would your wizarding students. The professors at Hogwarts are all experts in their field, but you’d also need to be able to take that knowledge outside of the classroom and use it to, for example, defend the school in times of peril.  \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Shop owner: for the creative entrepreneur   \n\n__Notable shop owners: Fred \u0026 George Weasley, Florean Fortescue, Mr Borgin \u0026 Mr Burke__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Selling magical wares to the wizarding masses* \n\nShop owner would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’re an extrovert who likes chatting to strangers and enjoys the hustle and bustle of a busy shopping street. You’d need to be savvy about how many Knuts to a Sickle there are, as well as being a creative type who can come up with innovative ways of presenting your magical goods. You’d have to decide what you’d sell of course, but you’d need to stand out from the crowd if you set up shop in Diagon Alley or Hogsmeade. So if the spectacle of Weasleys’ Wizard Wheezes fills you with ideas and artistic spirit then this might be the wizarding career for you.   \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Healer: for the responsible all-rounder \n\n__Notable Healers: Dilys Derwent, Poppy Pomfrey, Hippocrates Smethwyck.__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Dealing with magical injuries and illnesses*   \n\nHealer would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’re a high achiever across the board. To be Healer in the wizarding world you would need at least an “E” at NEWT level in Potions, Herbology, Transfiguration, Charms and Defence Against the Dark Arts. But that’s not all, you have to have a pretty strong stomach when faced with magical injuries – Madam Pomfrey saw some pretty gruesome ones throughout her time, including Harry’s boneless arm! A strong constitution and an excellent mind are a must for this career, but so is a kind and caring heart.  \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Wandmaker: for the secretive forager  \n\n__Notable Wandmakers: Ollivander, Gregorovitch__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Making wands and selling them to witches and wizards* \n\nWandmaker would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’ve got an eye for detail and don’t settle for less than perfection. You’d need to be good at crafts and working with materials – wands don’t make themselves! You’d also need to be a relentless forager, searching for the exact woods and core materials you’d need to make each individual wand. We feel like this career would also suit someone a little mysterious – the wand chooses the wizard after all…  \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Curse-Breaker: for the adventure-seeking intellectual \n\n__Notable Curse-Breakers: Bill Weasley__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Finding treasure for Gringott’s bank*  \n\nCurse-Breaker would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’re interested in a ‘challenging career involving travel, adventure and substantial, danger-related treasure bonuses’ – or at least that’s what is said on the pamphlet. Bill Weasley was a curse-breaker and it sounds like you’d need to be pretty smart – he got twelve OWLs. Judging by his example, this career would suit you if you’re into Arithmancy, and you’re cool in a crisis as well as interested in travelling the world. Oh, and you should probably be okay with risk taking – it doesn’t sound like the safest career option out there…  \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Wizarding writer: for the curious wordsmith \n\n__Notable writers: Rita Skeeter, Gilderoy Lockhart, Bathilda Bagshot__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Sharing wizarding stories, knowledge and gossip with quill and ink* \n\nWriter would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou just can’t stop scribbling. You would likely be an expressive person who loves to get their thoughts down on paper and has a way with words. If you like investigating and talking to people you might be more suited to the journalistic route like Rita Skeeter. If telling stories is more your cup of Pumpkin Juice then it might be that magical books are your calling – though make sure you avoid presenting fiction as fact like the once-famous Lockhart.   \n\u003cbr\u003e\n\n## Professional Quidditch player: for the competitive sports-lover  \n\n__Notable Professional Quidditch Players: Viktor Krum, Ginny Weasley, Oliver Wood__ \n\n*Main responsibility: Playing the glorious game of Quidditch for a living and entertaining the masses* \n\nProfessional Quidditch Player would be the right wizarding career for you if…  \n\nyou’re competitive and courageous. Quidditch isn’t for the faint-hearted so you’d need to be fine with the danger of soaring Bludgers and dizzying falls off moving broomsticks. You’d need to be a team player as well as motivated as an individual – particularly if you’re playing a position like Seeker. Fame can come with being a professional player – as Viktor Krum knew very well – so you’d need to be okay with celebrity status and attention too.  \n\nWhich of these wizarding careers sounds most like you? Let us know on our Wizarding World Twitter, Instagram or Facebook pages! Even Professor Lupin had the perfect spell for... summoning a piece of chewing gum to go straight up Peeves the poltergeist’s nose. How very specific. ALL SECRET CODE OR ENCHANTED CONTENT","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"5pjGg1O8g0NYmdITUba28D","name":"hide-from-discover"}]}],"section":[{"_updatedAt":"2021-02-10T11:14:46.234000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"2rmt6rAaxmf2A0cS4BAESv","entryTitle":"WEB-FEATURE-TEXTSECTION-which-hogwarts-subject-study-owl-level","text":"## If you’re crafty and creative... you’d take Charms \n\nDespite what Neville’s grandmother says about Charms being a ‘soft option’, it actually sounds like one of the most useful Hogwarts lessons out there. We’re told that Harry’s mum, Lily, was particularly adept at casting charms (remember Professor Slughorn’s anecdote about the lily that turned into a fish?) and the spells you learn in the lesson sound, well, quite charming.\n\nCharms allow you to conjure things from thin air, bewitch objects, move things, or simply make your day a little easier. Whether it’s decorating the house for Christmas or opening a locked door, every Charm just seems to make the world a bit brighter. And we’re not just talking about Lumos! \n\n![WingardiumLeviosa WB F1 FlitwickTeachesCharmsClass 00356404](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/23IGLVpSUYoES0mowGqOqC/09d766667b4f0ed30eabf31e3f0df919/WingardiumLeviosa_WB_F1_FlitwickTeachesCharmsClass_00356404.jpg)\n\n## If you’re good at future-planning or obsessed with your weekly Horoscope... you’d take Divination \n\nAre you one of those people that schedules every little thing in your life? Daily to-do lists, weekly to-do lists, a perfectly colour-coded calendar, perhaps? In that case, you’d probably enjoy Divination, even if certain people (ahem, Hermione) are sceptical of the subject holding much truth to it. But imagine how useful it would be to be able to decipher your dreams, read tea leaves and understand the stars! Sure, with the subject being inconsistent, you may not win the lottery, but you might at least have a good idea if it’s going to rain next Tuesday. \n\n## If you’re a fabulous cook... you’d take Potions \n\nPotions is all about precision, timing, creativity and good intuition. It’s also about ignoring the chiding words of Severus Snape, but we imagine you don’t have that problem. So, if you love cooking, are constantly baking bread or already mentally planning your next big lasagne – we feel like Potions class would lend itself well to your expertise as a transferrable skill.\n\nAfter all, following the instructions of a potion (stirring things counter-clockwise, chopping ingredients in the absolutely perfect way, etc.) is basically like cooking Muggle recipes. And thanks to a good cook/Potioneer’s natural instincts, you would already know certain pitfalls to avoid. Remember when Neville’s Shrinking Solution turned orange? You, as an intuitive food expert, would never let this happen to your concoction, unless you were making marmalade. \n\n![wb-potions-class-background](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/4NDgfXWk5pcrDOA85Qcb3I/d13bbf32dc216f53302e0b3b9c5fadfd/release_1_potions_class.png)\n\n## If you like solving puzzles... you’d take Ancient Runes \n\nThe elusive Ancient Runes is not a Hogwarts subject we know much about, as Harry didn’t take it. Hermione did, however, and was often seen with a big chunky textbook on the topic. So, this is certainly a class for the deeper thinkers among you, as it’s all about translating and solving things. We imagine it’s all a bit like a cryptic crossword – only a thousand times harder. But if you have a logical brain and a lot of patience, we imagine you’d get a lot out of Ancient Runes, just as much as you get out of your Sunday afternoon Sudoku puzzle.\n\n## If you’re an indecisive person... you’d take Transfiguration\n\nLife is full of trivial decisions to make – which outfit to wear, what hairstyle to have, which meals to cook, which books to read. Thankfully, with Transfiguration, if you change your mind about something, you can magically alter it. Professor McGonagall’s class is all about the power of transformation – turning animals into water goblets, things like that. If you get really good at Transfiguration, you could even learn about more advanced things, like how to become an Animagus. Ultimately, this is the perfect strand of magic for people who just don’t know what they want – so at least you know you’d be making a good decision by picking this for your O.W.L.s! \n\n![WB-HP-philosophers-stone-harry-ron-scabbers-transfiguration-desks-CROP](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/6rHbykSNii6enk6mxIWwIR/a29f32300798fd534767c8185f8700ca/ron-harry-teaser-image.jpg)\n\n## If you love sci-fi movies, you’d take Astronomy \n\nAstronomy is all about studying stars and analysing the movement of planets – an O.W.L topic for the more celestial-minded people reading this. We imagine those who love space films might enjoy this topic, as you’ll be learning all about what is going on in the great beyond. Just be careful when listening to this complex lesson – Harry once thought Jupiter’s moon Europa was covered in mice, not ice.  \n\n## If you’ve got a head for numbers... you’d take Arithmancy \n\nArithmancy is another lesson we didn’t learn much about, but thanks to Hermione (who, of course, took it) we have a basic idea. Arithmancy is all about finding the magic in numbers – and numerous magical jobs, including being a Curse-Breaker, depended on you having an O.W.L in this subject. So, basically, if you understood simultaneous equations and know the numbers of Pi off by heart, your brain would adore Arithmancy. \n\n## If you’re obsessed with Wikipedia articles... you’d take History of Magic \n\nWe never got the best impression of History of Magic through Harry’s eyes, as it was taught by Professor Binns, who never had the best...delivery of the subject. But come on, this is History of Magic! There are hundreds of amazing stories from wizarding past that we’d love to know more about! If you feel the same and consider yourself a bit of a Muggle history buff, then just imagine how much there is to unfurl here. We can just picture you now, nose-deep in a book about the goblin rebellions, at two o’ clock in the morning.\n\n## If you’re constantly buying plants... you’d take Herbology \n\nPlants just put us all in a better mood – although some of the species we meet in Professor Sprout’s lessons are a little more complicated. Still, if you’re quite green fingered (ie: you don’t kill a house plant within four seconds of owning it) you’d probably excel in Herbology easily. Despite the odd bout of Devil’s Snare or avoiding the cries of a Mandrake, it strikes us as a soothing subject. After all, Neville loved it.\n\n![WB-HP-F2-Chamber-of-Secrets-hermione-and-students-wear-earmuffs-in-greenhouse-herbology](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/1ehIX4oxbnJONrDcQ3Hnar/505f959f1f84f5e79e2bc86b8b4c123f/WB-HP-F2-Chamber-of-Secrets-hermione-and-students-wear-earmuffs-in-greenhouse-herbology.jpg)\n\n## If you’re always seeking justice... you’d take Defence Against the Dark Arts \n\nThe wizarding world had a darker side, as we know all too well, making Defence Against the Dark Arts a crucial subject for Harry. In fact, this was always Harry’s favourite lesson. The subject wasn’t just about learning about Dark magical creatures, deadly curses or learning defensive magic, though, it was about building up a steely determination against the evils of the world. If you are particularly passionate about upholding justice in society, Defence Against the Dark Arts would be perfect.\n\n![harry-dementors-lupin-office](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/6qmPS48v32aKtwCY6K7nUl/d463025b4e6da61d09672648a7b1c80c/harry_wand.png)\n\n## If you love animals or even just cat memes... you’d take Care of Magical Creatures \n\nDespite Harry, Ron and Hermione not choosing to study this topic to O.W.L level – we love the idea of Care of Magical Creatures. Sure, with Hagrid teaching the topic, you were more likely to study a Blast-Ended Skrewt rather than, you know, something nice – but credit to Hagrid who also taught us about Nifflers and Hippogriffs – both fascinating magical creatures in their own right. Our hero from Fantastic Beasts, Newt Scamander, loved them so much he became a Magizoologist, and taught us about the kindness and patience it takes to be one. The animal-lovers among you will no doubt be aware of being patient with our own Muggle pets, so this is one for you.\n\n![WB F3 Buckbeak HagridAndBuckbeak HP3-FX-256](//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/5rAM6WlLyMQIWuYsMag6e2/673ffcdd4c4a4287994b77e72b90712c/WB_F3_Buckbeak_HagridAndBuckbeak_HP3-FX-256.jpg)\n\n*Which Hogwarts subject speaks to you the most?*"}],"tags":[{"_updatedAt":"2019-08-01T11:51:53.952000","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"3B1lhNkNAFaVH3lS0WLMxV","name":"feature"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:07:02.831000","contentTypeId":"tag","contentfulId":"L1Cef6BUiA2eC84VPklgq","name":"hide-from-app"},{"_updatedAt":"2020-02-20T13:06:54.732000","authorComment":"This excludes the content item from its index page i.e. quizzes run to Quiz section automatically, but for other Quiz content (publishing elsewhere) it excludes from Discover. In *Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone* it was referred to as a Put-Outer and Dumbledore used it to turn off the street lamps in Privet Drive. At that point, who could have guessed that this rare item would become so important?\n\nIf it wasn’t for the additional magical properties of the Deluminator, later left to Ron in Dumbledore’s will, Ron would never have found Harry and Hermione again in *Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.* And given that when Ron found Harry he was about to drown in pursuit of a Horcrux, arguably that Deluminator saved Harry’s life."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:31:00.301000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"WBSTL_PM_Deluminator-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-WBSTL_PM_Deluminator 3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b1","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:17:13.353000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"WBSTL_PM_Deluminator","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":464,"width":823},"size":45984},"fileName":"WBSTL_PM_Deluminator.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/WBSTL_PM_Deluminator/f813fb4984fc00157d0263383c538409/WBSTL_PM_Deluminator.jpg"},"title":"WBSTL_PM_Deluminator"}},{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:17:59.082000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b2","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-2","text":"## Harry’s wand\n\nAnother object that became instrumental in Harry’s life was the wand he discovered in Ollivander’s shop. Or rather, the wand that discovered him. We got an inkling of the particular significance of Harry’s wand when Ollivander revealed that the phoenix who donated the feather in the wand’s core – a phoenix we later learn was Dumbledore’s Fawkes – also donated a feather to the wand that became Voldemort’s.\n\nLater, this relationship between the two wands was very important. The shared cores saved Harry’s life in *Goblet of Fire*, when the joining of his and Voldemort’s wands bound together and created the ‘Priori Incantatem’ effect. But back in Ollivander’s shop years before, Harry had no idea what his wand’s relationship to Voldemort’s might mean in that moment; he just thought of it as something that couldn’t be helped, like his relationship to Aunt Petunia, for example…"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T17:29:48.838000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"4L0FPfx6vY6Eq4coUwucSg-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-DiagonAlley PM B1C5M4 HarryAtOllivanders Moment 4vs1M3LQLCAGc8ECsA2kY6","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-25T23:20:18.948000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"4L0FPfx6vY6Eq4coUwucSg","description":"Harry gets his wand at Ollivanders ","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1500,"width":4140},"size":892475},"fileName":"DiagonAlley_PM_B1C5M4_HarryAtOllivanders_Moment.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/4L0FPfx6vY6Eq4coUwucSg/3d5396be068eddca7300e7036c3c3671/DiagonAlley_PM_B1C5M4_HarryAtOllivanders_Moment.jpg"},"title":"DiagonAlley PM B1C5M4 HarryAtOllivanders Moment"},"imageAltText":"Harry at Ollivanders wand shop.","imageCaption":"© JKR/Pottermore Ltd. ™ Warner Bros."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:17:56.648000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b4","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-4","text":"## The Sorting Hat\n\nThanks to Ron, Harry already knew which house he wanted to be sorted into (Gryffindor, obviously) and which house he definitely didn’t (Slytherin, even more obviously). What he didn’t anticipate was that this decision would be made by a hat.\n\nThe Sorting Hat tried to tell Harry that Slytherin could help him to greatness, but Harry was determined, and eventually it put him in Gryffindor. This moment came back to haunt Harry in *Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets*, as he faced ‘Heir of Slytherin’ rumours and discovered a talent for Parseltongue that he shared with Voldemort. It wasn’t until the Sorting Hat presented him with Godric Gryffindor’s sword and he defeated Voldemort-as-Tom-Riddle that he felt like a true Gryffindor."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:34:52.594000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"nt4ZV4578WQWcCUK68QIq-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-undefined 3Abdqr65ugmuwOmIyieyY0-g0","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:11:03.528000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"nt4ZV4578WQWcCUK68QIq","description":"The Sorting Ceremony","file":{"contentType":"image/png","details":{"image":{"height":768,"width":780},"size":450683},"fileName":"The-Sorting-Ceremony.png","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/nt4ZV4578WQWcCUK68QIq/79f8703e2c0bb0305058bc221003b4bf/The-Sorting-Ceremony.png"},"title":"The Sorting Ceremony"},"imageAltText":"The Sorting Ceremony","imageCaption":"© JKR/Pottermore Ltd. ™ Warner Bros."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:18:16.530000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b6","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-6","text":"## A bezoar\n\nA throwaway remark from Professor Snape in his first Potions lesson told Harry that a bezoar was a stone taken from the stomach of a goat which, when used correctly, could save the life of a person who had been poisoned.\n\nIn *Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince,* this point was made more forcefully in Harry’s heavily annotated copy of *Advanced Potion-Making*. Scribbled in the margin on a page about antidotes were the words, ‘Just shove a bezoar down their throats.’ Harry didn’t know that these were Snape’s notes, but when Ron was poisoned by some mead intended for Dumbledore, this instruction and the stock of bezoars in the Potions cupboard saved Ron’s life."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:42:21.186000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"2UNFGML78AOAIokkakYCc6-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-RonWeasley WB F6 RonWeasleyInHospitalWingSurroundedByFriends Still 080615 Land 610NmMORfamKY0UQC6UmMo-b4","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:32:07.099000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"2UNFGML78AOAIokkakYCc6","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2554,"width":3831},"size":1644372},"fileName":"RonWeasley_WB_F6_RonWeasleyInHospitalWingSurroundedByFriends_Still_080615_Land.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/2UNFGML78AOAIokkakYCc6/406d50522d73768bec1429bf5bdb5f93/RonWeasley_WB_F6_RonWeasleyInHospitalWingSurroundedByFriends_Still_080615_Land.jpg"},"title":"RonWeasley WB F6 RonWeasleyInHospitalWingSurroundedByFriends Still 080615 Land"},"imageAltText":"Ron in the Hospital Wing from the Half-Blood Prince.","imageCaption":"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:18:06.092000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b8","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-8","text":"## Harry’s first Snitch\n\nGiven his flying ability, Harry’s appointment as Gryffindor’s Seeker seemed inevitable. Less predictable was the way he helped Gryffindor secure victory against Slytherin in his first Quidditch match – catching the Snitch by nearly swallowing it.\n\nThis unusual method gave the Snitch in question a particular significance that we don’t learn until *Deathly Hallows,* when Harry discovered Dumbledore had left him it in his will. As he handed it over, Minister for Magic Rufus Scrimgeour explained that Snitches remember the touch of the first human to handle them.\n\nHow and when Dumbledore rescued the Snitch we don’t know, but Harry knew there was a reason Dumbledore had returned it. Sure enough, when he put it to his lips it revealed its message: ‘I open at the close.’ Later, when Harry whispered, ‘I am about to die,’ the Snitch opened to reveal the second of the three Hallows: the Resurrection Stone, giving Harry the chance to speak with his loved ones before facing Voldemort."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:31:01.596000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"5nOtatqANiSeQCIMACSCEo-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-DeathlyHallow WB F7 ResurrectionStoneInOpen Snitch Image 100615 Port 3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b9","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:18:54.164000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"5nOtatqANiSeQCIMACSCEo","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2243,"width":3216},"size":494619},"fileName":"DeathlyHallow_WB_F7_ResurrectionStoneInOpen Snitch_Image_100615_Port.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/5nOtatqANiSeQCIMACSCEo/555ac330bc72610ab2339cd7d689b4d1/DeathlyHallow_WB_F7_ResurrectionStoneInOpen_Snitch_Image_100615_Port.jpg"},"title":"DeathlyHallow WB F7 ResurrectionStoneInOpen Snitch Image 100615 Port"}},{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-20T18:18:18.687000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b10","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-10","text":"## The Invisibility Cloak\n\nHarry’s Invisibility Cloak arrived as a present during his first Christmas at Hogwarts. It was a gift from Dumbledore, although Harry didn’t know that at the time, and it used to belong to his father.\n\nIt was Ron who pointed out how valuable such cloaks were, but even he didn’t know how rare Harry’s was: because this cloak was the final Deathly Hallow. What’s more, we learn, Harry was descended from Ignotus Peverell, one of the three original owners of the Hallows. Legend had it the cloak was given to Ignotus by Death, who wanted to trick the Peverells into joining him. While his brothers asked for objects with dark powers, wise Ignotus simply wanted to evade Death. And so the Invisibility Cloak in Harry’s possession showed no signs of age, having been created to survive any curse or charm.\n\nInitially Harry used the Invisibility Cloak to get around Hogwarts in secret. So, when its true significance became clear, it’s quite a thing to think that Harry once left a Deathly Hallow on top of the tallest tower in Hogwarts following a midnight rendezvous with a baby dragon."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:44:16.863000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"5CS3jszJccqqGAi4agyAko-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-Cloak PM InvisibilityCloakIllust 3buxayphnqkiuEuEsqIYAU-b14","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:42:55.087000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"5CS3jszJccqqGAi4agyAko","description":"The Invisibility Cloak","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2032,"width":3840},"size":1264152},"fileName":"Cloak PM InvisibilityCloakIllust.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/5CS3jszJccqqGAi4agyAko/c2c9cb6e02d9082e436f542c4e67de9e/Cloak_PM_InvisibilityCloakIllust.jpg"},"title":"Cloak PM InvisibilityCloakIllust"},"imageAltText":"The Invisibility Cloak","imageCaption":"© JKR/Pottermore Ltd. ™ Warner Bros."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-02T06:59:18.919000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3x5DlmpBmgyQCy0eAUWgyK-b12","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-BODY-OF-magical-objects-from-philosophers-stone-that-became-important-later-12","text":"\u003cem\u003eTo celebrate the 20th anniversary of\u003c/em\u003e Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone\u003cem\u003e, every Friday Pottermore will explore themes, moments, characters and much more from the very first Harry Potter story. The broomstick is one of the most sought-after wizarding world items, of course, so we imagine many of you would immediately pick this. You may not even fancy playing Quidditch, but simply want to go exploring.\n\nIn Diagon Alley, crowds of young wizards are usually found gazing in wonder outside Quality Quidditch Supplies’ window – and really, who can blame them? So, if you adore the outdoors and have a taste for adventure, we imagine you’d immediately be shouting “up” and flying off somewhere nice with your very own broom.\n\n[You can read all about brooms and the magical sport in our Quidditch hub.](https://www.wizardingworld.com/collections/quidditch)"},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T18:28:33.913000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"2OvaWfoA2Qymi82MyUEWES-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-WB F3 Firebolt HarryReceivesAFirebolt HP3D-1700 UP HPE3 5LfuKgg2SQgu2weUGaayua-b4","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:20:14.044000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"2OvaWfoA2Qymi82MyUEWES","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2667,"width":4000},"size":1910081},"fileName":"WB F3 Firebolt HarryReceivesAFirebolt HP3D-1700_UP_HPE3.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/2OvaWfoA2Qymi82MyUEWES/7b295d4db7e9572d6be05e9fc475a39b/WB_F3_Firebolt_HarryReceivesAFirebolt_HP3D-1700_UP_HPE3.jpg"},"title":"WB F3 Firebolt HarryReceivesAFirebolt HP3D-1700 UP HPE3"}},{"_updatedAt":"2021-01-21T16:52:26.468000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"3HpnEx4bUF0hSSu80k300E","entryTitle":"magical-objects-right-for-you-text-section-2","text":"## If you’re solitary... you’d have the Invisibility Cloak \n\nDo you relish those stolen, quiet moments where, basically, everyone gives you a little peace? Then you’d likely enjoy the Invisibility Cloak; an opportunity to be perfectly inconspicuous. Think of how lovely it would be, after a hard day, to simply slip the cloak over your head and be left to your own devices. You could go anywhere without being bothered, no small-talk, nobody giving you leaflets. Harry usually used his cloak for solving mysteries or hiding from undesirable wizards. We would most likely use ours for when we wanted a time out at parties.\n\n## If you worry a lot... you’d have a Sneakoscope \n\nThis one is perhaps arguable – as the Sneakoscope is a device that whizzes around furiously if there’s someone untrustworthy nearby. Perhaps, if you’re someone with a tendency to over-worry, a Sneakoscope would make you worry more? Or perhaps you would feel validated, and prefer knowing that there is something to worry about? Nonetheless, a Sneakoscope may not relieve your anxieties, but at least you’d have a heads up that your concerns weren’t all in your head.  \n\n## If you like to put on a show... you’d have enchanted fireworks \n\nSometimes, Muggle inventions make their way into the wizarding world, but with some major enhancements. \n\nA good example of this is fireworks – which are bigger, brighter and far more animated than ours. There are different brands available, such as Dr Filibuster’s range, but don’t forget that the Weasley twins also have their own brand (Weasleys’ Wildfire Whiz-bangs) which they used to great, dramatic effect upon their epic exit from Hogwarts in Order of the Phoenix. A great way to advertise their products, too. Unlike our little Catherine wheels and paltry rockets, the Weasley twins’ fireworks were described as ‘pyrotechnical miracles’ and included sparkly dragons and never-ending firecrackers. \n\nSo, next time you want to dramatically leave a room, kind of like how Fred and George did, these would definitely turn a few heads.  "},{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-11T17:49:35.920000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"2BlEo5Db6RwpSaViFEVob5","entryTitle":"Image-magical-mischief-collection-hero-weasley-firework","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-03-11T17:57:03.165000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"4B2NBzJDpvMFPU8bMdkbuB","file":{"contentType":"image/png","details":{"image":{"height":1808,"width":3000},"size":9263760},"fileName":"MM Hero  2.png","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/4B2NBzJDpvMFPU8bMdkbuB/01645659516854c7c8ed2a4c949fd2eb/MM_Hero__2.png"},"title":"Image-magical-mischief-collection-hero-pixie"}},{"_updatedAt":"2021-01-21T12:37:02.039000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"25vzpAguJcfNmL6dFU4WgD","entryTitle":"magical-objects-right-for-you-text-section-3","text":"## If you love to travel... you’d have a Portkey \n\nPerhaps one of the most enviable elements of the wizarding world is that the community simply have far better public transport options than us. Even the Hogwarts Express has a far better food trolley than most of our Muggle ones.\n\nStrictly speaking, a Portkey is usually an ordinary object, like a boot or a bucket, but placed with an enchantment to take you somewhere specific. This is how Harry got to the Quidditch World Cup, for example. Think of the possibilities you, a fervent traveller could have, with such an item always at your disposal. No admin, lugging heavy luggage or long plane flights required! Just imagine tapping a toaster and turning up in Thailand. Or patting a pencil and popping up in Peru. Or grabbing a guitar and galivanting off to Greece. Well, you get the idea. \n\n[Learn more abourt Portkeys here.](https://www.wizardingworld.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/portkeys)\n\n## If you’re a perfectionist... you’d have a Time-Turner \n\nHave you ever thought of the absolute perfect comeback to say to someone who said something rude to you one time? Except you thought of it six days later? Now, with a Time-Turner, you could actually go back and say that incredibly witty thing to that man who barged into you at the post office. In fact, you could pop back whenever you wanted inside your own timeline and sort out all manner of minor mistakes you’ve made along the way. Finally! That garbled way you asked out that person you fancied could be rectified! You never dropped and smashed that entire jar of pasta sauce in the supermarket! You wouldn’t want to change anything too major, though – time travel is very complicated business. Just ask Albus Potter and Scorpius Malfoy.\n\n[Read more about Time-Turners right over here.](https://www.wizardingworld.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/time-turner)"},{"_updatedAt":"2021-01-21T12:36:58.958000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"5mKyDjIvhiLOF593YbVoH7","entryTitle":"magical-objects-right-for-you-text-section-4","text":"## If you appreciate the finer details in life... you’d have some Omnioculars \n\nOminoculars appear to be like Muggle binoculars but with far better features, basically. Harry learnt this when he acquired some at the Quidditch World Cup. \n\nSo how would you use them? Perhaps you’re a keen photographer. Maybe you need a better pair of glasses, but you’ve not bothered sorting your subscription yet. But really, these Ominoculars would be perfect for anyone simply wanting to study their surroundings in excellent definition. \n\nAnd the best part of Ominoculars is that you can rewind things you have just seen and watch them over again. For example, you could relive a nice sunset or rewatch the moment a baby takes their first steps. Ron used this feature to... watch someone pick their nose. But maybe you appreciate the finer things in life. \n\n## If you’re a little scatty... you’d have a Remembrall \n\nWe’ve all been in the shoes of a young Neville Longbottom, who had quite the reputation for being forgetful. This handy device, essentially a glowing orb that turns red when your mind fails you, was good for Neville – although didn’t actually tell him about the thing he’d forgotten. Still, we imagine this item would be ideal every moment you leave the house and realise you’ve left your keys, wallet or phone behind. Or perhaps it would simply never stop glowing – driving you a little bit mad. Maybe you would be thrilled to discuss all things Quidditch with Oliver Wood, or perhaps fishing for Freshwater Plimpies with Luna Lovegood is more your style. No matter who you are – you would be sure to find a friend here. We’ve decided who we think you would want to hang out with based on your personality.  \n\n## If you are a creative dreamer who is happy doing their own thing…you’d hang out with Luna Lovegood\n\nThere is nobody quite like Luna Lovegood. She’s happy to dance to the beat of her own drum and is never afraid to dream. Her creativity shines through from her Butterbeer cork necklace to her ability to think outside the box. If you are someone who has ever been described as eccentric, away with the fairies or simply odd – you’d find a kindred spirit in Luna. We can see the two of you drinking an infusion of Gurdyroots while reading your copies of The Quibbler (upside down of course) and discussing the important things in life – like the existence of the Crumple-Horned Snorkack and the best way to get rid of Wrackspurts."},{"_updatedAt":"2021-03-15T13:57:40.353000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"7llQj5dx13ZjQSRY4tSE1j","entryTitle":"WB-F5-order-of-phoenix-luna-reads-quibbler","image":{"_updatedAt":"2021-03-15T13:57:38.238000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"47nkH2urIyYr6MSdEcg4wW","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1600,"width":2400},"size":2566433},"fileName":"WB-F5-order-of-phoenix-luna-reads-quibbler.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/47nkH2urIyYr6MSdEcg4wW/66720ae6103baa98a26e2865595762b7/WB-F5-order-of-phoenix-luna-reads-quibbler.jpg"},"title":"WB-F5-order-of-phoenix-luna-reads-quibbler"}},{"_updatedAt":"2021-03-15T14:00:08.721000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"RxGgRzEjaVclAi71lo49Z","entryTitle":"which-hogwarts-student-would-you-be-friends-with-text-section-2","text":"## If you are a major sports enthusiast… you’d hang out with Oliver Wood\n\nAre you obsessed with everything sport? Do you religiously keep track of all the scores? Do you get a real kick out of formulating new tactics in minute detail? If this sounds like you, then we believe that Gryffindor Quidditch Captain Oliver Wood is your perfect pal. There is no doubting Wood’s dedication (even if his teammates don’t appreciate practising at the crack of dawn) but it’s his sportsmanship and loyalty that really shines through. His commitment to his team, his house and his school is unwavering. If you’re someone who values loyalty, passion, and sport – then we think you two would click.\n\n## If you are into the finer things in life… you’d hang out with Draco Malfoy\n\nDraco Malfoy is used to a certain opulent standard of living. His family home, Malfoy Manor, is a grand mansion and he doesn’t lower his standards, thank you very much. Draco is certainly confident that he is special and believes he deserves the very best. Whether it is the rare Hand of Glory or the best wizarding robes money can buy – he knows he’s worth it. Although we don't condone Draco's behaviour during school, you could be just the company that he needs (especially if you can show him how to enjoy life’s luxuries without letting it go to your head!)."},{"_updatedAt":"2019-10-01T19:13:52.399000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"3VjdY8Vsre0QUmo00aa88s-img","entryTitle":"PMARCHIVE-DracoMalfoy WB F8 DracoGoyleZabiniInRoomOfRequirement Still 080615 Land 2Oez5xvKm4kSQcgSk0GsYa-b7","image":{"_updatedAt":"2019-09-24T05:29:26.437000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"3VjdY8Vsre0QUmo00aa88s","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":2592,"width":3888},"size":951887},"fileName":"DracoMalfoy_WB_F8_DracoGoyleZabiniInRoomOfRequirement_Still_080615_Land.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/3VjdY8Vsre0QUmo00aa88s/caf5f267b6c33b39f50ea44f70d3034b/DracoMalfoy_WB_F8_DracoGoyleZabiniInRoomOfRequirement_Still_080615_Land.jpg"},"title":"DracoMalfoy WB F8 DracoGoyleZabiniInRoomOfRequirement Still 080615 Land"},"imageAltText":"Draco Crabbe abd Zabini in the Room of Requirment ","imageCaption":"Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2"},{"_updatedAt":"2021-03-15T14:01:48.144000","contentTypeId":"textSection","contentfulId":"30RNH89XU1COBHM7BIZy00","entryTitle":"which-hogwarts-student-would-you-be-friends-with-text-section-3","text":"## If you are intent on making the world a better place… you’d hang out with Hermione Granger\n\nHermione Granger may be known for being the cleverest witch of her age, but she used that intelligence to make the wizarding world a better place. She freed the dragon from Gringotts bank (even though it was dangerous) because she knew it was the right thing to do. She played a crucial role in defeating Voldemort and never wavered in her commitment to the cause. In fact, that dedication to change led to her become Minister for Magic. If you’re someone who can’t let injustice and inequality lie, likes to sign petitions and always does what is right rather than what is easy – then Hermione would be a fan of yours. We can just imagine the two of you standing side by side, at a protest for Muggle-born rights, being a force for good in the world.\n\n## If you love a good gossip… you’d hang out with Ernie Macmillan\n\nDo you feel a little thrill of excitement when you hear a new rumour? Or enjoy bonding over scandal with others? Then you would be friends with Ernie Macmillan. While he is kind, his pompous nature does mean that he has an unfortunate habit of believing everything he hears (like thinking Harry was the heir of Slytherin). Ernie could do with a friend who can help him sort fact from fiction and come to the right conclusions more quickly. If you know the difference between a harmless rumour and a damaging lie, then you would be an excellent influence on Ernie.\n\n## If you would like to find your place in the world… you’d hang out with Albus Potter\n\nSometimes it can be difficult to navigate the world when you are unsure of your place in it. Maybe you feel you are different to those around you and are not sure what direction your life is supposed to take. If this sounds like you, then Albus Potter would make a great friend. As a Slytherin in a family full of Gryffindors, it is no wonder Albus feels out of place. However, as time goes on, he learns to accept and even like the parts of him that make him a Slytherin (though it wasn’t easy to get to that point). Just like his friendship with Scorpius, we know that Albus would be loyal, patient, understanding and would help you discover who you really are."},{"_updatedAt":"2020-08-24T21:52:39.772000","contentTypeId":"image","contentfulId":"3hc9goEK1aAY3Kd9PvYNef","entryTitle":"Cursed_Child_Albus_Scorpius","image":{"_updatedAt":"2020-08-24T21:52:36.834000","contentTypeId":"asset","contentfulId":"bxlTGHa0D23KGEb5V3Lcc","file":{"contentType":"image/jpeg","details":{"image":{"height":1333,"width":2000},"size":289074},"fileName":"Cursed_Child_Albus_Scorpius.jpg","url":"//images.ctfassets.net/usf1vwtuqyxm/bxlTGHa0D23KGEb5V3Lcc/82994a0f8cd211d257365d44f6590933/Cursed_Child_Albus_Scorpius.jpg"},"title":"Cursed_Child_Albus_Scorpius"},"imageAltText":"Albus \u0026 Scorpius in Cursed Child.
